intro: Quercus comasaguana, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist forests and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The bark is thick and fissured, providing a distinctive appearance and offering some protection against pests and diseases.
